heading: cell-phone calls streamed on net
subheading: basement webcasters are using an aol-owned streaming service to pipe private cellular phone conversations out onto the net. aol is digging into the issue. by chris oakes.
author: chris oakes
text: you can hear almost anything on the internet these days -- maybe even your own phone conversations. america online said thursday morning that it was investigating internet broadcasts of private cell-phone conversations captured with private scanner hardware and streamed out over the net through its shoutcast service.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
